prequal.name: Lets get started
prequal.title: Lets get started
prequal.intro1: Thank you for your interest in the Leiomyosarcoma (LMS) Project.
prequal.intro2: Here's what sign up and participation looks like:
prequal.intro2_l1: Registration - Answer a few short questions about yourself or your child (3 min)
prequal.intro2_l2: Consent form - Read through and sign the consent form (10-15 min)
prequal.intro2_l3: Medical Release Form - Tell us where you or your child have been treated (5 min)
prequal.intro2_l4: Surveys - Answer questions about you or your child's experience with cancer (10-15 min)

who_enrolling.prompt: First, who is signing up for the LMS Project?*
who_enrolling.myself: I have been diagnosed with LMS and I'm signing myself up.
who_enrolling.child: My child has been diagnosed with LMS and I am signing up for them or with them.

age.prompt: How old are you? / How old is your child? *
age.range_hint: Please enter an age between 0 and 110
age.restriction_hint: In order to participate in the project, a parent needs to help you. When your parent is with you, click back and select "My child has been diagnosed" and complete the registration together.

country.prompt: Where do you live? / Where does your child live? *
country.label: Select Country
country.ineligible_hint: Project Singular is currently open only to participants in the United States and Territories or Canada. Thank you for your interest.

about_you.intro_text: Please tell us more about $ddp.isGovernedParticipant("your child","you") by answering the questions below. As you fill out the questions, the answers will be automatically saved. If you would like to leave the survey and complete it at another time, it will be available in the Dashboard. You can reach us by emailing info@lmsproject.org if you have any questions. If you would like to withdraw from the project, you can contact the team at info@lmsproject.org at any time. Any information that has already been entered into the system cannot be withdrawn, however no additional data will be generated.
about_you.assigned_sex_prompt: $ddp.isGovernedParticipant("What sex was your child assigned at birth","What sex were you assigned at birth?") ?
about_you.assigned_sex_note: Sex assigned at birth is the assignment and classification of people as male, female, or intersex based on a combination of external anatomy, internal anatomy, hormones, and chromosomes.
about_you.gender_identity_prompt: What is $ddp.isGovernedParticipant("your child's","your") gender identity? Select all that apply
about_you.gender_identity_note1: Gender identity is a term to describe a person's inner sense of being male, female, both, neither or some other gender. It can correspond to or differ from a person's sex assigned at birth.
about_you.race_prompt: Which of the following categories best describes $ddp.isGovernedParticipant("your child","you")?
about_you.race_note: Select all that apply. Note you may select more than one group.
about_you.hispanic_info: Since you selected "Hispanic, Latino, or Spanish" in the previous question, we would like to ask some follow up questions about $ddp.isGovernedParticipant("your child's","your") racial and ethnic identity.
about_you.mixed_race_prompt: Do you consider $ddp.isGovernedParticipant("your child","yourself") to be mixed race, that is belonging to more than one racial group, such as Mestizo, Mulatto or some other mixed race, or not?
about_you.afro_hispanic_prompt: Do you consider $ddp.isGovernedParticipant("your child","yourself") to be Afro-Latino, Afro-Hispanic, Afro-Caribbean, or not?
about_you.afro_hispanic_note: (An Afro-Latino or Afro-Hispanic is a Latino or Hispanic with black African ancestry)
about_you.indigenous_native_prompt: Do you consider $ddp.isGovernedParticipant("your child","yourself") to be indigenous or Native American (such as Purepecha, Mixteco, Zapoteco, Nahua, Maya, Tzotzil, Taino, Arawak, Quiche, Aymara, Quechua, Kwichua, Mapuche, Guarani, or some other indigenous or Native American origin), or not?
about_you.other_comments_prompt: Tell us anything else you would like about $ddp.isGovernedParticipant("your child","yourself") or $ddp.isGovernedParticipant("their","your") cancer.
about_you.how_hear_prompt: How did you hear about the project?
about_you.nested-race-hint-text: Provide the name of the tribe in which you are enrolled or affiliated or your tribal descent.

race.americanindian_or_alaskan_note: (For example: Aztec, Blackfeet Tribe, Mayan, Navajo Nation, Native Village of Barrow (Utqiagvik) Inupiat Traditional Government, Nome Eskimo Community, etc.)
race.tribe_label: Tribe you are enrolled or affiliated or your tribal descent
race.asian_note: (For example: Asian Indian, Chinese, Filipino, Japanese, Korean, Vietnamese, etc.)
race.black_or_african_note: (For example: African American, Ethiopian, Haitian, Jamaican, Nigerian, Somali, etc.)
race.hispanic_or_spanish_note: (For example: Colombian, Cuban, Dominican, Mexican or Mexican American, Puerto Rican, Salvadoran, etc.)
race.middleeastern_or_african_note: (For examle: Algerian, Egyptian, Iranian, Lebanese, Moroccan, Syrian, etc.)
race.hawaiian_or_islander: Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander
race.hawaiian_or_islander_note: (For example: Chamorro, Fijian, Marshallese, Native Hawaiian, Tongan, etc.)
race.white_note: (For example: English, European, French, German, Irish, Italian, Polish, etc.)

gender.transgender_tip: A term describing a person whose gender identity and/or gender expression does not align with societyâ€™s expectations based on the sex they were assigned at birth
gender.nonbinary_tip: An umbrella term describing gender identities that are outside of the traditional gender binary of male or female
gender.genderqueer_tip: Denoting or relating to a person who does not subscribe to conventional gender distinctions but identifies with neither, both, or a combination of male and female genders.
gender.genderfluid_tip: A term describing a person whose gender identity and/or gender expression is not always the same
gender.agender_tip: A term describing someone who does not have a gender
gender.twospirit_tip: An umbrella term used by some Indigenous North Americans to describe Native people in their communities who fulfill a traditional third-gender ceremonial and social role in their cultures
gender.questioning: Questioning or unsure of gender identity

source.internet: General internet/Online sources (search engines, patient advocacy group website, blogs, online newsletter, etc.)
source.media: Media (news media program, print or digital advertisement, promotional video, article in magazine or newspaper, radio or podcasts, brochure, etc.)
source.advocacy_group: Advocacy Group (Cancer patient advocacy group, Cancer related-nonprofit, Other Patient Organizations)
source.wom: Word of mouth (friend/family, study staff, study participants, patient, support group, etc.)
source.study_staff: Study leader or staff, Count Me In team member
source.doctor: Doctor/Clinical care center (physician, doctorâ€™s office, hospital or medical institution, treatment center, etc.)
source.physician: Physician, doctor, nurse, other medical professional etc.
source.hospital: Hospital, medical institution, or treatment center
source.event: Event (patient conference, science or research symposium, networking event, etc.)
source.science_conference: Science or research talk, conference, or symposium

option.none_describe: None of these fully describe me/my child
